snippet: The bloody mission to wrest Falluja from insurgents in November 2004 meant more to the Marines than almost any other battle in the 12 years of war in Iraq and Afghanistan.
abstract: Many Marine Corp veterans who fought during 2004 invasion of Falluja in Iraq, now witnessing retaking of city by Sunni insurgents, have had their faith shaken in what their mission achieved; many consider it corps' biggest and most iconic fight since Vietnam, with nearly 100 Marines and soldiers killed in action and hundreds more wounded.
lead_paragraph: The bloody mission to wrest Falluja from insurgents in November 2004 meant more to the Marines than almost any other battle in the 12 years of war in Iraq and Afghanistan.

headline.main: Falluja’s Fall Stuns Marines Who Fought There
headline.print_headline: Falluja’s Fall Stuns Marines Who Fought There

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
